tmove(Vector3d) - Method in class fast3d.graphics.Turtle3d
moves the turtle relative to it's position and rotation: if the turtle looks to the right than it will go to the right on call tmove(Vector3d.forward())
if the pen is down then draw a line from current position to the new position
tmoveTo(Vector3d) - Method in class fast3d.graphics.Turtle3d
moves the turtle to the absolute position given and remains it rotation
if the pen is down then draw a line from current position to the new position

toAbsoluteCoordinate(Vector2d) - Method in class fast3d.graphics.Texture

toCartesian() - Method in class fast3d.math.Vector2d
converts this vectors polar coordinates (x=angle, y=distance) to Cartesian coordinates toCartesian().toPolar() should cause no change unless a rounding mistake
toCartesian() - Method in class fast3d.math.Vector3d
converts this vectors polar coordinates (x=inclination (theta), y=azimuth (phi), z=distance) to Cartesian coordinates toCartesian().toPolar() should cause no change unless a rounding mistake
toLogicalCoordinate(Vector2d) - Method in class fast3d.graphics.Texture
converts the given absolute coordinate on this texture (max = width or height) to the corresponding logical coordinate (max = 1)
toPolar() - Method in class fast3d.math.Vector2d
converts this vectors Cartesian coordinates to polar coordinates
a polar coordinates representation is given by an angle (new x-coordinate) and a distance (new y-coordinate) from the coordinate-center toPolar().toCartesian() should cause no change unless a rounding mistake
toPolar() - Method in class fast3d.math.Vector3d
converts this vectors Cartesian coordinates to polar coordinates
a polar coordinates representation is given by two angles (new x-coordinate as inclination (theta), new y-coordinate as azimuth (phi)) and a distance (new z-coordinate) from the coordinate-center toPolar().toCartesian() should cause no change unless a rounding mistake
toRoundedString(int) - Method in class fast3d.math.Vector2d
to display the vector in an user-appropriate form with x digits after the comma
for negative parameters, the coordinates will be displayed rounded.

triangles - Variable in class fast3d.complex.Group
direct access to the internal storage permitted
TriangleStripGenerator - Class in fast3d.util
a base class to generate a mesh out of its vertices
you may extend this class inline just overriding the makeTriangle method
the length of the triangle-strip can be quite infinite large (considering the amount of memory of the JVM)
TriangleStripGenerator() - Constructor for class fast3d.util.TriangleStripGenerator
constructs a plain mesh
TriangleStripGenerator(boolean) - Constructor for class fast3d.util.TriangleStripGenerator
constructs a plain mesh
TriangleStripGenerator2d - Class in fast3d.util
a base class to generate a surface-mesh out of its vertices
you may extend this class inline just overriding the makeTriangle method and call add(Vector3d) for all vertices in the mesh and if the mesh is complete - you may call addToUniverse(Universe)
one dimension of the 2d-surface is limited to the amount of calls of add(Vector3d) you determine in the constructor by setting the rowLength
if that dimension is the width, than the height can be quite infinite large (considering the amount of memory of the JVM)
to get triangles in the internal storage (given by getTriangles) you need to add at least (rowLength + 1) vertices
TriangleStripGenerator2d(int, boolean) - Constructor for class fast3d.util.TriangleStripGenerator2d
constructs a plain surface-mesh
TriangleStripGenerator2d(int) - Constructor for class fast3d.util.TriangleStripGenerator2d
constructs a plain surface-mesh
trotX(double) - Method in class fast3d.graphics.Turtle3d
rotates the turtle around the x-axis
trotXDeg(double) - Method in class fast3d.graphics.Turtle3d

trotY(double) - Method in class fast3d.graphics.Turtle3d

trotZDeg(double) - Method in class fast3d.graphics.Turtle3d

tsetPen(boolean) - Method in class fast3d.graphics.Turtle3d
determines whether to draw a line on move-actions
Turtle3d - Class in fast3d.graphics
gives the ability to draw directly into a 3d-scenery like a turtle
each turtle-method starts with t
you can move around in the scenery drawing lines or not (specified by tsetPen(Color or null)), push and pop on a history of transformations and rotate the turtle on it's own coordinate system
on default the pen is down
Turtle3d(Graphics2D, Shader, Light...) - Constructor for class fast3d.graphics.Turtle3d
calls super and locates the turtle at (0,0,0) with no rotation
TurtlePanel3d - Class in fast3d.simple
a Panel3d using Turtle3d-graphics to render a scenery
render(Turtle3d) is called after rendering the universe as usual
TurtlePanel3d() - Constructor for class fast3d.simple.TurtlePanel3d
 
twoPi - Static variable in class fast3d.util.math.MathUtil
the ratio of the circumference of a circle to its radius - 6.283185307179586 - 360 degrees
